Node.Text: You have heard the news about Alex, right?
Yeah, but let's not talk about that. There are some lovely desserts in the cafe tonight!
And right now, you're prying where you shouldn't.
Look, I'm just as concerned as everyone else. I am. But I don't want to focus on the negatives - that's not how live works. You have to move on.
I've spent too much of my life waiting for things that won't come back.
What is your connection to Thomas?
I already told you. He reminds me of someone.
Yes, but you never told me whom.
I hope they still have cheesecake downstairs.
He reminds me of my fiance back home. I haven't told anyone else yet, but... well, it's been long enough.
I met him during my studies and he proposed. Then, shortly after, he was drafted into the war. I waited for months for him to come back to me.
His letters were all that kept me sane, until one day, I received one in someone else's handwriting. His commander had written to tell me of my fiance's death.
They said he fought bravely, but that meant nothing to me. I lost my love, and if I had the chance, I'd do anything to get him back.
Node.Hint: Lucy is extremely devoted to love and those she wishes to protect. Would she kill to keep someone to herself?
